headline: Alphabet’s Chief Legal Officer  Is Leaving Amid Investigation
abstract: David Drummond, who played a key role for the company since it was founded, was being investigated for relationships with several women at the company.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — David Drummond, the chief legal officer of Google’s parent company, Alphabet, and one of its most senior executives, is leaving the internet giant amid an investigation into his relationships with women who worked at the company.
